The issue that Riot has already stated with Garens ultimate is that it scales infinitely (with the enemy target's health) and that it isn't tied to Garen attacking his enemy; He doesn't earn the execute damage in some scenarios.
With a champion like Darius, you have to get those bleedstacks to deal damage.
With Cho'gath, it's actually a flat nuke that scales moderately with ap(it doesn't help execute at all, and it can be cast at the beginning of a fight to deal as much damage as it would at the end of the fight), but it's encouraged to be cast as an execute by rewarding the player for using it as the culling strike (which again, if you have the 6 stacks, you don't need to save the feast to be the killing blow)
With Riven,a big part of the power budget in her ult goes into the bonus AD and attack range; The physical damage execute is more of a bonus

With Garen, you can just walk into someone else's lane, push R and kill. You don't have to touch them beforehand at all.


I think that the way his ult should be fixed is that it: should have it's cooldown reduced. But instead of damage scaling based on a flat value of missing enemy health, it scales based on the flat value (NOT percent) of Garen's missing health. This is nice change because it encourages the player to build tank/stack health, it means that Garen has to engage the enemy (otherwise his preserverance passive will screw up the damage of his ult), and it makes sense thematically (The ultimate itself is called "Demacian Justice", justice for the injured demacian).
Although such a change would weaken his current existing combo (I'm talking about the Q, E, R that was highlighted in his champion spotlight), it would fix the issue of his ult having such a high CD.

Garen's not a Tank, people need to realize this. Just because he gains 20% bonus stats from the items he purchases, and regens at a hilariously high rate out-of-combat is not a reason to justify tank builds. Still not enough. Its base damage is super low at rank 1. Personally, I would prefer giving it a higher early base damage and higher missing health scaling on later ranks, but a similarly long cool down. It has a super long early cool down to keep him from repeatedly executing a lane opponent if he gets ahead, and needs that gating. However, the damage it gives is not good enough to fully warrant having that long of a cool down. Basically, it needs more damage for viability, but long cool down to prevent excessively powerful 1 kill snowballing.

Live works like this: 175/350/525 (+28.57/33.33/40% Missing HP), 160/120/80 second cool down.

What I would suggest: 200/375/550 (+30/40/50% Missing HP), 150/120/90 second cool down.

This gives it a minimal power increase early (by +25 damage, +1.43% more missing health damage, and 10 second lower cool down). This allows for slightly increased reliability at gaining kills, and allows him to not be so weak for as long.

Late game, it is significantly more powerful (+25 damage, +10% more missing health damage,), but also has a 10 longer cool down than live. This late game cool down trade off would allow his execute to pack more of a punch, but not be a constant (oppressive) threat.

EDIT: I don't know why, but I felt compelled to do this just now. I did the math and with his passive, Spirit Visage and its passive, Warmog's out of combat passive, and the recovery, perseverance, and second wind masteries all active at once, Garen can surpass 820 HP5... that is over 164 health per second.
140/110/80 sounds good to me, or 130/105/80.
